channel.title: Compiling Etc

item.title: Compiling Etc
item.dc:creator: @JavaLearner JavaLearner
item.description:
@JavaLearner wrote:

You can run the source on every computer, you simply need it’s IP and it needs to be portforwarded. Then you have to use that IP and change

to

Obviously, change TheIpFromTheComputerYouAreHostingOn …

Read full topic

item.title: Compiling Etc
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

Firstly, chars may only be ASCII…

item.title: Compiling Etc
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

You don’t change the IP in the source - only in the the client.
I’m pretty sure those characters are illegal characters because variables are stored in UTF-8 formatting if I remember correctly, and those variables are not valid.

Read full topic

item.title: Compiling Etc
item.dc:creator: @lord0ftacos lord0ftacos

How do I change the server ip to mine on the source? I have looked everywhere and I cant find it
